name: Hotel Palazzo Leti

reviews.text: We got an auction deal at this hotel and it was defo worth what we paid ($400 for 4 nights). Worth it for a v nice stay in umbria. Spoleto isn't necessarily where I wld return as there is loads of scaffolding/closed buildings and it just seemed pretty dead in the evenings (no doubt much better during the festival). Must have a car to visit countryside.
reviews.title: Quaint hotel, fantastic terrace!
Great Value and Location - Helpful Management
reviews.text: Pros: great room, nice bathroom, ok breakfast (cld do with more types of ham and cheeses perhaps), friendly staff, fantastic terrace for enjoying wine in the evening with views

Cons: see above breakfast comment, wld have also been lovely to have been able to have dinner on the terrace (maybe have a set menu guests have to say in the morning whether they want it - wld be a good income earner for the hotel.)
reviews.title: Palazzo Leti is spectacular

likes.liked: — The beauty of the hotel, the wonderful owner

reviews.text: We spent 4 nights here in early October and felt it was the best hotel during our 3 plus weeks in Italy. The room was very nice, the staff wonderful, breakfast sumptuous, and the location within Spoleto excellent. The only downside was, if you have a car, be very careful getting in and out of the hotel as the roads are very narrow. Beyond that, take the time to see Spoleto and saty at this very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent and well managed hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Palazzo Leti for eight nights. We were visiting Umbria and found Spoleto to be a good jumping off point for day excursions in the area. The hotel has everything that makes a stay memorable: beautifully appointed rooms, charming public spaces, excellent breakfasts but above all else a superb staff. Laura Bartocci and her husband, Gian Paulo, are outstanding hosts who make all visitors feel welcome and pampered. They were extraordinarily helpful with day trips and went to great lenghts to deal with our car rental company after rental car broke down in another town.
reviews.title: Hospitality at its best
Fantastic
reviews.text: We stayed at the Palazzo Leti for four nights in October, 2005. I couldn't recommend it more. The rooms are great, the property is fantastic, and the owners are wonderful. They've poured their heart and soul into the property and it shows. Their recommendations for activities and dining were spot on. Spoleto is a great town, and the Palazzo Leti is the perfect place from which to see it.

reviews.title: SIMPLY DELICIOUS
reviews.text: A family run luxurious hotel,very friendly and intimate at the same time.We also dined at 'Il tempio del Gusto' ,as the owner of the hotel suggested and it was an unforgettable experience.Really worth.

reviews.title: Palazzo Leti.....magical, marvelous! Spoleto splendid!
reviews.text: We have just returned from honeymoon in Italy and in three weeks of staying in some of the loveliest places in that lovely country, Palazzo Leti was our favourite. The view was breath-taking, the garden gorgeous, the room supremely comfortable and cosseting, the bathroom just so and the breakfast the best we encountered, but what blew us away was the way we were made to feel like friends of the family. The owners and staff went far beyond the call of duty time and again and I really can't recommend their lovely hotel highly enough.

reviews.title: Perfection!!!
reviews.text: And on top of all that, it's an absolute bargain.

We stayed one night in November 2006. The couple who own it are very pleasant and helpful. We had a wonderful room and reliable wireless high speed internet access in our room. The location is also very good. The small grounds are very well kept up. It's a bit tricky to drive into the site, but the directions by signs are excellent. We enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.liked: — Attractive setting; wireless high speed internet in room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a superior room after reading all the great reviews and overall the hotel lived up to expectations. The only negative comments would be the view from our room (202) which was not very nice and the colour scheme of the bathroom! Also no tea & coffee making facilities. The distance from the main shopping/eating area of the historic town is a good 10 minutes' walk downhill and then back up again. So I wouldn't reccommend it for people with wobbly legs. Driving around Spoleto is out of the question - even getting through the tiny lanes to the hotel and parking in the square is pretty difficult. Everything else was fine. The owner was very nice and friendly, the cornettoes at breakfast were excellent.
reviews.title: Very nice

likes.liked: — The garden & exterior, the comfortable beds, the heating worked really well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We ate in a fantastic trattoria not reccommended by the owner but by Slow Food called Osteria del Trivio. Spoleto is a lovely town but currently under major construction/restoration work.
reviews.title: Opulent, not oppressive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a package through the Pallazzo's website, which included three nights, two dinners (without wine) at the "best" restaurants in Spoleto, ticket to city museums amongst other things. The Palazzo kept it's end of the bargain with convenient parking immediately in front of the hotel (although trying to find the Hotel was a bit hair raising), lovely breakfast, gentle hosts, spectacular views from the garden terrace, tastefully decorated rooms and centrally located to major attractions. The museum ticket did not get us into every museum, and earthquake repairs (from the 1997 earthquake) meant that other museums had restricted access. The included two "best" dinners were wonderful, although one of them kept us to a "set menu". The other one "Il tempio del Gusto" was just magnificent!! With poor exchange rate we found this hotel very expensive - it was the splurge of our holidays, however the genteel and relaxed staff made us feel pampered without feeling out of place. We were there on extremely hot days, yet found the hotel airconditioned at a comfortable cool level. Everthing the others reviews say about the quality is all true!
reviews.title: I cannot wait to go back
Do go to the Leti
reviews.text: What a fabulous place. It was perfect in every way. The room was comfortable and clean. The bed was great and breakfast was nice. The couple that runs the hotel are so nice and always made sure we had everything we needed. The best part of the day was sitting on the patio with a nice glass of wine - what a great view.

reviews.title: marvellouse place in a paradise
reviews.text: thank you very much for help me to discover Palazzo Leti. It 's a wonderful Place for every occasion. For our honey moon i think it were the most comfortable place in spoleto . It offered us every comfort and the availability of every romantic options ... like a beautiful restaurant close to it, his partner. The magical and unforgetable view, and so many many other things ... thanks a lot another time and i hope that you will go ahead to advice to other people like us ... this marvellous and other places.

description: Palazzo Leti is an historic residence brought back to life and to its original ancient beauty after a long and careful restoration. Our dream is to provide people with a place to stay that is not just a hotel but also a lovely peaceful location in the middle of nature.
